news_items.content: Here is the rewritten version of the news:
Chennai, India - Here are some of the top stories making headlines in Chennai today:
Poor road conditions and vending zone concerns on 15th main road, Anna Nagar raise safety issues.
Kodungaiyur dumpyard bio mining has resumed due to environmental concerns.
Tamil Nadu bans raw-egg mayonnaise over Salmonella and E. Coli fears.
Three Chennai college students drowned in the Coimbatore River.
A woman stole a patient's gold chain at Omandurar Hospital, and was arrested.
The Tamil Nadu government has decided to ban raw-egg mayonnaise due to health concerns.
Chennai also experienced strong dust storms in Delhi, with an Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) issuing red alerts.

Additionally, India made official announcements regarding the US-Pakistan ceasefire, with no broker responsible for it found. The United States and Saudi Arabia have signed a major defence deal worth $142 billion during Donald Trump's visit.
There were also reports of AI startups in Saudi Arabia making significant advancements, including a new partnership with Cisco to enter AI technology.
In Chennai, an Apple development team is working on custom chips for smart glasses and more.
